article.content:
Adding text to your TikTok videos is one of the best ways to create inclusive and engaging videos on the app.

In this blog post, we‚Äôll walk you through how to use TikTok‚Äôs text editor, how to use on-screen text to tell a story,  and why it‚Äôs so important.

Ready? Let‚Äôs go!


How To Add Text Using The TikTok Text Editor
The TikTok text editor is simple and user-friendly. Once you begin adding text to your TikTok videos, your engagement and overall performance can skyrocket!

Step #1: To start adding text, create a new TikTok by tapping the ‚Äú+‚Äù button on the bottom of your feed. Either film a new video, open a draft or upload content from your camera roll.

Create your first tiktok
Step #2: Edit and trim your video together. Once you‚Äôre happy with it, tap ‚ÄúNext‚Äù.

Step #3: Tap ‚ÄúText‚Äù on the bottom left.

How to Use TikTok Sounds
Step #4: Use your keyboard to type something anywhere on the screen.

How to Use TikTok Sounds
Step #5: Choose from a selection of fonts and styles and play around with the text size and location by pinching and moving the text on the screen.

Step #6: Tap the text and select ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù and set the text duration by tapping ‚ÄúDuration‚Äù.


One of the most important parts of TikTok‚Äôs text editor is the ability to change the duration of how long your text appears on the screen. Setting text durations is a powerful way to use on-screen text to tell a story.

TikTok Sounds
Use the sliding scale to have your text appear or disappear at your desired time. If you have specific times for your text like matching it to the beat of the song, this step may take a little bit of time to get right.

Step #7: To preview your text,  press the play button located just above the editing bar.

tiktok sounds
Step #8: When you‚Äôre happy with it, select the checkmark in the bottom-right corner of the screen to get your video ready to post.

TikTok Text Editor: Fonts and Colors
In the text editor, you have the option to choose from a selection of fonts and colors.

To change fonts and colors, simply tap through the fonts and colors at the bottom of your screen. Just like on Instagram, tap the lines to play around with your text alignment.

How to Use TikTok Sounds
Once you‚Äôre happy with how it looks,  tap ‚ÄúDone‚Äù in the top-right corner.

TIP: To make your text pop with the highlight,  tap the ‚ÄúA‚Äù on the left side of the screen and watch your text go bold.

3 Benefits of Using Text on TikTok
There‚Äôs a lot of reasons why using text on your TikTok‚Äôs is important. To help you understand the way this tool can impact your content, we‚Äôve broken down 3 benefits.

#1: Inclusivity
Using text on your TikTok videos is a great way to be inclusive. Not only does adding TikTok video captions help those who may not have their sound on, but it also helps those who have hearing conditions.

Accessibility is important in the digital world ‚Äî especially for those with visual and hearing conditions.

It‚Äôs a simple and effective way to create a more inclusive and inviting TikTok profile. 

#2: Storytelling
Adding text and setting custom durations can help you tell a story. And, many viewers actually watch videos without sound, so using text on your TikTok is an incredible way to catch your audience‚Äôs attention.

Not sure how to do it? Take LaterCon speaker and TikTok Expert Sawyer Hartman‚Äôs advice.

‚ÄúFirst, I use the text to establish a problem or grab attention. I usually address people‚Äôs fears and concerns right off the bat. And then, step by step, I solve the problem,‚Äù explains Sawyer.


Regardless of the video, the text on your video should always help tell a story.

‚ÄúImagine your perfect viewer is sitting and watching your video with the sound off, what text can you put and what story can you tell that will convince them to turn their sound on?‚Äù

Learn more TikTok tips from TikTok experts themselves in our free TikTok For Brands Workshop! 



#3: Higher Views and Engagement
Text is a great way to capture eyeballs and lead viewers to watch your whole video! When you include text that provides context ‚Äî or even mystery ‚Äî you‚Äôll intrigue your audience.

When viewers visit your TikTok profile, they will see all your TikTok video thumbnails. They may be more likely to press on the video if they see what it‚Äôs about.

See how Dr. Jordan Estrada uses text on his thumbnails to show his audience what each video is about.


Another way to use text to encourage engagement is by telling your audience to wait until the end of the video for a surprise ‚Äî intriguing them to watch till the very end!

Completion rate and repeat viewership is a big indicator your content is performing well on TikTok and can land you a spot on the For You page when done right.

Try it out and see how it works for your audience. If you‚Äôre not sure how your videos with text are performing, review your TikTok analytics. Check to see if there are any themes on your performance between TikToks with text and no text.

Now that you‚Äôre an expert on TikTok‚Äôs text editor,  you‚Äôre able to utilize this text feature like a pro for your next video!

Happy creating!
article.title: [Shortcuts]How to Add Text to Your TikTok Videos

Music, popularly known as TikTok Sounds, is key to the viral app. Not only do Sounds help with creativity,  but they‚Äôre also a strategic growth tool.

Understanding and using TikTok‚Äôs sounds is a great way to help your business or brand grow.

Ready to learn everything about TikTok Sounds? Follow along!


What Are TikTok ‚ÄúSounds‚Äù?
TikTok Sounds (including Original Audio) is the backbone of TikTok.

If you‚Äôve had a scroll on the TikTok For You Page, you‚Äôve likely noticed a pattern. Every single video either uses Sounds or Original Audio. And, in most cases, several videos during your scroll will actually have the same song! That most likely means it‚Äôs either trending or viral.

TikTok Sounds are powerful ‚Äî using Trending Sounds or creating a great Original Audio track is a huge opportunity to push your content to a larger audience. And hey ‚Äî you may even go viral!

Musical artists have actually made fortunes after going viral on TikTok thanks to the platform‚Äôs ability to showcase the artist who made the sound. Did you know Lil Nas x‚Äôs Old Town Road started on TikTok?

Not only have musical artists created viral Sounds, but so have brands, businesses, and creators.

How to Navigate TikTok Sounds

Using Trending Sounds (and all Sounds) on TikTok helps bring your content to the next level. From Keeping Up with the Kardashians audio clips to trending songs, you can find whatever you want in the Sounds Library.

When you open up TikTok and begin scrolling the FYP, you‚Äôll notice how every single video is accompanied by a song ‚Äî whether original audio or from the TikTok Sounds Library.

There are several ways you can choose a TikTok sound for your video. You can browse the TikTok Sounds Library, save songs used by other users, or create your own.

We‚Äôre breaking it all down for you below.

TikTok Sounds Library
The TikTok Sounds library is where the magic happens. It‚Äôs where you can search and browse all of TikTok‚Äôs music library.


It‚Äôs everchanging and very user-friendly ‚Äî organized by genre, popularity, trends, and much more! Access the Sounds Library by tapping the ‚Äú+‚Äù of the home screen and tapping ‚ÄúSounds‚Äù at the top.

Your Ultimate Guide To Sounds on TikTok 
You can also search for Sounds on TikTok‚Äôs Discover Page. Simply type the song into the search bar and find ‚ÄúSounds‚Äù at the top.

Everything You Need To Know About TikTok Sounds
Trending songs are always changing and are based on the TikTok algorithm. It‚Äôs based on TikTok users‚Äô behavior, video shares, saves, and of course, plays.

Trending Sounds are a great way to maximize visibility on your video ‚Äî increasing your chances of landing on the For You page.


TikTok For You Page
As you‚Äôre scrolling through your For You page, you might stumble upon a video using the perfect song.

When you find a song you want to use, simply tap on the sound. You‚Äôll be brought to the audio page. Here you can either tap ‚ÄúUse this sound‚Äù to film right away or tap ‚ÄúAdd to Favorites‚Äù to save for later.

How to create your first tiktok
How To Add Sounds To Your TikTok Videos
Now that you know where to find Sounds on TikTok, it‚Äôs time to learn how to actually add Sounds to your TikTok video.

Adding TikTok Sounds To Existing Videos
If you‚Äôre creating a TikTok using content from your camera roll, you can either upload the video with its own audio or you can add a Sound from TikTok‚Äôs Sound Library.

To begin, tap ‚Äú+‚Äù. Upload your content and then tap ‚ÄúSounds‚Äù in the bottom left corner.

How To Use TikTok‚Äôs Sounds Library
Here is where you‚Äôll see recommended songs and sounds based on your video‚Äîincluding some curated trending options.

Scroll through to explore the entire Sounds library. You can choose from playlists, trending, and viral songs, new music, and so much more. If you want to use a song from your Favorites, tap ‚ÄúFavorites‚Äù.

Everything You Need To Know About TikTok Sounds
Once you‚Äôve selected your song, click and drag the soundwaves to choose which part of the song you want to play in your video.

Once you‚Äôve landed where you want your Sound to start, tap the checkmark.

When you Create your TikTok ‚Äî before you get into the Sounds library ‚Äî you‚Äôll notice a few recommended sounds at the bottom of your screen for you to seamlessly use without much effort. These sounds are TikTok‚Äôs suggestions for you, based on the video you‚Äôre editing.

Are you ready to create your first TikTok? Learn everything you need to know to make your first video here.

Adding to TikTok Sounds to New Videos
Adding music when you‚Äôre shooting content in TikTok allows the music to guide you and your creativity in real-time.

Step #1: Tap ‚Äú+‚Äù to start shooting

Step #2: Select ‚ÄúSounds‚Äù at the top of your screen.

What is TikTok
Step #3: Browse the sound library then tap the sound and select it.

Step #4: Record your video and your chosen sound will play as you film.

Your Ultimate Guide To Sounds on TikTok
FREE COURSE!
How to Use TikTok for Business
Learn how your brand can create perfectly optimized TikTok content and start creating viral videos.

WATCH NOW

 

How to Create Original TikTok Sounds
Original Sounds range from people singing and creating voiceovers to creating music mashups and viral commentary.

The great thing about Original Sounds? They can show up in trending and recommended categories. And, more often than not, Original Sounds are often made by independent creators rather than major artists! This is a huge growth opportunity.

Take the viral hit ‚ÄúBored in the House‚Äù by @curtisroach for example.


One important thing to remember is that anything you record on TikTok can be used as a sound used by someone else. When a song is recorded on TikTok, it becomes an Original Track ‚Äî meaning no sounds were used other than your own voice.

Take Lad Bible‚Äôs own ‚ÄúDarude Soapstorm‚Äù aka DIY Sandstorm for example. This sound was uploaded natively and now features over 400 videos using this same sound from a number of creators.

To create your own original audio, you can either talk while you film in-app or you can record a voiceover after filming. Learn how to record a voiceover here.

If you upload a video from your camera roll, the audio from that video will play. You can adjust the audio by tapping ‚ÄúVolume‚Äù on the right-hand side.

How To Use TikTok‚Äôs Sounds Library
TIP: If you‚Äôve created an Original Sound, take a look at your Sound by tapping the bottom right audio to see if anyone else has used it to create a video. You never know what you‚Äôll find.

Now that you know everything about TikTok sounds, it‚Äôs time to explore and use these tools to further (and enhance) your TikTok marketing strategy.

Introducing TikTok‚Äôs newest video editing feature ‚Äî Stitch.

Stitch on TikTok allows users to trim and edit other users‚Äô video clips into their own. It‚Äôs a new way to collaborate with more creators, grow your reach, and possibly gain virality!

Ready to dive into the details? We‚Äôre sharing everything we know about Stitch on TikTok here:


What is Stitch on TikTok?
Stitch is TikTok‚Äôs newest video editing feature that allows users to integrate other users‚Äô video clips into their own.

stitch on tiktok
While it is a new feature, it‚Äôs not totally off base with TikTok‚Äôs Duet tool. The Duet tool, which is popular amongst creators, allows users to create reaction videos in a split-screen.

With Stitch, instead of the split-screen format, the videos are integrated into each other. Both the original and new videos are cut and edited together into one video.


According to TikTok, ‚ÄúStitch is a way to reinterpret and add to another user‚Äôs content, building on their stories, tutorials, recipes, math lessons, and more.‚Äù

Even though Stitch is new, many creators are already flexing their creative muscle and testing out the new feature.


ICYMI: TikTok has also introduced a new Marketing Partner Program for advertisers: TikTok For Business Marketing Partner Program.

With 20 certified partners in areas like campaign management and creative development, TikTok is working with the best in the biz to help marketers bring their content to the next level. 

According to TikTok, ‚Äúbrands and marketers can now tap into our trusted ecosystem of partners including agencies and technology providers who can help them build successful campaigns and take advertising on TikTok to the next level.‚Äù

Learn more about TikTok‚Äôs Marketing Partner Program here.

How to Turn Stitch On and Off 
By enabling the Stitch tool, you are opening your content up to millions of potential collaborations. Think about the possibilities ‚Äî it can be an incredible way to increase reach and gain virality.

If you aren‚Äôt comfortable opening up your videos to all of TikTok, users have the ability to choose whether they want to allow others to Stitch their content. 

There are 2 ways to do this. You can change them in Privacy Settings and before you share each individual video.

Here is how to change Stitch settings:

Step #1: Head to your profile and tap the three dots in the top right corner.

stitch on tiktok
Step #2: Tap ‚ÄúPrivacy‚Äù

stitch on tiktok
Step #3: Tap ‚ÄúWho can Stitch with your videos‚Äù

stitch on tiktok
Step #4: Select ‚ÄúEveryone,‚Äù ‚ÄúFriends,‚Äù or ‚ÄúNo one.‚Äù Tap the back arrow to save.

stich on tiktok
But that‚Äôs not all. Even with the overall settings in place, you can still individually change the Stitch settings for each video you upload. 

Do this by switching the ‚ÄúAllow Stitch‚Äù on/off toggle before you tap ‚ÄúShare.‚Äù

stich on tiktok
When you Stitch a video, TikTok automatically gives proper credit to the original creator in the new video caption. Not only does it give credit, but it also links directly to the original video.

stich on tiktok
Plus, users can‚Äôt erase the hashtag and profile tag in the video caption ‚Äî ensuring all creators are given the proper attribution!


How to Create a Video Using Stitch
The new video feature is simple to use ‚Äî you‚Äôll be creating Stitch videos in no time.

stich on tiktok
Follow these steps to get started:

Step #1: Find and select the video you‚Äôd like to Stitch.

Step #2: Tap the send arrow on the right-hand side of the screen.

stich on tiktok
Step #3: Select ‚ÄúStitch‚Äù

stich on tiktok
Note: If ‚ÄúStitch‚Äù is faded, that means the original creator has denied Stitch access.

stich on tiktok
Step #4: Scroll through the video and select a clip. You can trim the clip how you like but you can only select up to five seconds from the video. Press ‚ÄúNext.‚Äù

stich on tiktok
Step #5: Once you‚Äôve selected the clip, record your section of the video.

While recording, the red at the top represents the original video and the blue represents what you‚Äôve recorded.

When you record your section, you can use a selection of TikTok‚Äôs typical editing tools. You can use the timer, change the speed, and add effects and filters.

Two main editing differences for Stitch videos? You aren‚Äôt able to upload content from your camera roll and you don‚Äôt have access to the TikTok Sound library.

Step #6: Now you are at the final editing stage. Record a voiceover, add text, stickers, filters, or effects. When you‚Äôre happy with the finished product, tap ‚ÄúNext.‚Äù

Step #7: Write a caption and choose your video settings. If you‚Äôre ready to post, tap ‚ÄúShare‚Äù.

And there you have it! Everything you need to know about TikTok‚Äôs newest video editing feature.  

Will you be using Stich on TikTok? Let us know what you think of the new feature in the comments!
article.title: [Tips]How to use Stitch: TikTok‚Äôs New Editing Feature

Are you ready to get started on TikTok?  You‚Äôve come to the right place.

In this step-by-step guide, we break down everything you need to know to get started on TikTok and create your very first video ‚Äî everything from how to set up your account to how to use all of TikTok‚Äôs editing tools.

Let‚Äôs get started!


Table of Contents:

Set Up Your TikTok Account
Film and Upload Your Content
Edit Your Video (In the App!)
Publish Your TikTok
Get Started on TikTok Step #1: Set Up Your TikTok Account
Before you can browse the famous For You page or post, you‚Äôll have to create a TikTok account.

First, go to the App Store or Google Play and download the TikTok app. Once downloaded, sign up with Facebook, Gmail, or Twitter, or create a new username and password using your email.

Create your first tiktok
By default, TikTok assigns all users a unique username made up of a random collection of letters and numbers. It‚Äôs not super cute, so let‚Äôs change that!

For best practice ‚Äî and maximum cross-platform discoverability ‚Äî set your username to your name or your business name, or whatever username you use for your other channels! This helps create a seamless extension of your already established brand.

TikTok username
TIP: Looking to do something different? Be creative by working with puns, punctuation, and more!

Once logged in, you‚Äôll be brought to the homepage.

It‚Äôs time to edit your profile! To edit, tap ‚ÄúMe‚Äù in the bottom right corner.


 Tap ‚ÄúEdit Profile‚Äù.

tiktok edit profile
First, let‚Äôs change our TikTok profile picture. TikTok allows you to choose between a static image or a video.

tiktok profile picture
It‚Äôs a good idea to align your profile picture, just like your username, with the picture you use across other social channels.

Your profile picture isn‚Äôt the only important piece of the TikTok profile puzzle.

Next, it‚Äôs time to write your TikTok bio.

tiktok bio
Your TikTok bio is important ‚Äî  it‚Äôs one of the first places your audience will look. TikTok allows up to 80 characters, allowing you to share a short and sweet bio at the forefront of your profile.

Add a tiktok bio
Not sure what to write for your bio? Here are 25 creative Instagram bio examples you‚Äôll definitely want to copy!

If you‚Äôre one of the lucky ones, you‚Äôll notice a ‚Äúwebsite‚Äù field in your edit settings.


However, only certain TikTok accounts can capitalize on the TikTok link in bio by default right now.
The TikTok link in bio (website field), is one of the few places where you can add a clickable link on the app, making it a valuable resource for brands looking to drive traffic and sales.

Check out this blog post for a step-by-step on how to add a link to your TikTok bio.

TikTok also allows for seamless YouTube and Instagram integration. It‚Äôs a good idea to input your Instagram and YouTube accounts so that your audience can follow you outside of TikTok.


They‚Äôll be showcased on your profile next to the follow button.


Now that your profile is all set up, it‚Äôs time to follow users and engage in content!

On TikTok, you don‚Äôt necessarily have to follow accounts to see their content. Most content appears on your personalized For You page.

Following accounts and engaging with content lets TikTok know what you‚Äôre interested in and helps TikTok‚Äôs algorithm create a personalized For You page.

The TikTok link in bio rollout is on its way ‚Äî and it‚Äôs going to be a game-changer for brands and businesses on the app!

TikTok users will be able to take advantage of the prime real estate on their TikTok profile to direct their followers outside of the app.

We‚Äôre jumping into all the benefits, details, and everything you need to know about how to get a clickable link in your TikTok bio:


TikTok Link in Bio: How to Get a Clickable Link on Your Profile
TikTok is testing out a new feature ‚Äî the link in bio on TikTok. While still in beta-testing, many users can start to take advantage of the new social commerce feature.

Like on Instagram, it will allow users to add a bolded clickable link directly on their profile.

TikTok Link in Bio
This is huge for brands, influencers, and businesses of all sizes on TikTok, as it‚Äôs the main way to drive followers to a website or e-commerce platform.

Ready to add a TikTok link in bio to your profile? Here‚Äôs how:

Step #1: Go to your TikTok Profile.

Only certain TikTok accounts have the link in bio by default right now. If you‚Äôre one of the lucky ones, you‚Äôll see a ‚ÄúWebsite‚Äù field after clicking ‚ÄúEdit Profile‚Äù on your TikTok profile page.


If you don‚Äôt have this option right now, you can still get your hands on a link in bio by joining the TikTok Testers program. Just follow these steps:

Step #1: Go to your TikTok profile.

Step #2: Tap the three dots in the top right corner.

Adding a TikTok Link in Bio
Step #3: Scroll down and select ‚ÄúJoin TikTok Testers‚Äù.

TikTok link in bio
NOTE: Not all countries will have this option available.

Step #4: Tap ‚ÄúTestFlight‚Äù and download it in the App Store.

TikTok Link in Bio
Step #5: Tap ‚ÄúStart Testing‚Äù and download the new version of TikTok.


Step #6: Open up your TikTok profile again.

Step #7: Tap ‚ÄúEdit Profile.‚Äù

Step #8: Add your link under ‚ÄúWebsite.‚Äù

TikTok Link in bio
And there you go! You should now see a clickable link in your TikTok bio!

NOTE: Some accounts may still not get the option to add a link to their profile, even after joining the TikTok Testers program. This could be due to your follower count, or the country you are in.

Why Having a Clickable Link in Your TikTok Profile is a Game-changer For Brands:
Just like adding a link in your Instagram bio, having a TikTok link in bio is a huge game-changer for brands and businesses using the viral app.


TikTok already allows users to connect their YouTube and Instagram accounts to their profile, but the link in bio is a much more versatile way to drive users to your domains.


If your TikTok feed is filled with brand mentions and product features, it makes sense to provide a way for your audience to easily transition from content consumers to customers.

For example, Tarte Cosmetics uses their TikTok link in bio to drive sales.

They typically include a call to action in the captions of their beauty tutorial videos, which is a great way to encourage followers to visit your website and shop your products!

Tarte Cosmetics on TikTok
With the right strategy, TikTok‚Äôs link in bio can be a key part of your brand‚Äôs sales funnel, and it also provides an opportunity to grow your community outside of the platform.

You can drive traffic to your website, increase email newsletter or course sign-ups, or push out a certain product launch ‚Äî the possibilities are endless.

Take The Washington Post, for example. The news outlet has seen huge success on TikTok and the addition of the link in their profile is just another way they‚Äôre maximizing on their traffic.


In their profile bio, they direct users to tap the link to check out their latest article. The moment you tap the link, you are automatically brought to The Washington Post‚Äôs subscription page ‚Äî a key part of their business model.


Once you‚Äôve got your TikTok link in bio all set, you can start driving traffic and sales for your business.

And the good news is, you can update it as often as you like!

article.author: mlew
article.content:
The TikTok algorithm may seem complex and mysterious ‚Äî but TikTok has (finally!) revealed exactly how it works!

From what hashtags you use, to your location, music choices, and even the very first TikTok video you liked ‚Äî they can all influence the TikTok algorithm.

Which is some serious intel for brands and businesses looking to get more engagement on their TikTok content.

In this blog post, we‚Äôre sharing everything we know about the TikTok algorithm and how you can start using it your advantage:


How the TikTok Algorithm Works (According to TikTok Themselves!) 
TikTok has finally lifted the veil on how the algorithm works, putting an end to months of rumors and speculation.

In a recent press statement, TikTok shared exactly how the #ForYou feed is calibrated and personalized to each account.

So before we jump into the nitty-gritty details of the TikTok algorithm, here‚Äôs what we know to be true ‚Äî straight from TikTok HQ!

What Factors Contribute to TikTok‚Äôs For You Page Video Suggestions?
If you‚Äôve scrolled TikTok, you‚Äôll know that the For You page is the best place to go to find the best new content.

Previously, we could only make assumptions that the For You page appeared to be a curated feed, pulling videos that are related to your profile, location, and similar to videos you‚Äôve already liked and engaged with.


But now, we have some concrete facts from TikTok on how the For You page reflects preferences unique to each user.

According to TikTok: ‚ÄúThe system recommends content by ranking videos based on a combination of factors ‚Äî starting from interests you express as a new user and adjusting for things you indicate you‚Äôre not interested in, too‚Äù.

These factors include things like:

User interactions: such as the videos you like or share, accounts you follow, comments you post, and content you create.
Video information: this might include details like captions, sounds, and hashtags.
Device and account settings: like your language preference, country setting, and device type.
And it doesn‚Äôt stop there.

Each of these factors is individually weighted by the TikTok‚Äôs For You recommendation system, meaning that each For You page will be completely unique to a user and their level of interest.

For example, TikTok explains that a strong indicator of interest could be if a user finishes watching a longer video from beginning to end.

This would receive greater weight than a weak indicator, such as whether the video‚Äôs viewer and creator are both in the same country.

From these ‚Äúindicators of interest,‚Äù For You page videos are then ranked based on the likelihood of a user‚Äôs interest in a piece of content.

But what about the age-old question of ‚Äúdo I need thousands of followers to go viral?‚Äù. In short, the answer is no.

TikTok explained that while a video is likely to receive more views if posted by an account that has more followers (by virtue of having a larger follower base), ‚Äúneither follower count nor whether the account has had previous high-performing videos are direct factors in the recommendation system.‚Äù 

Check out @kei.honey‚Äòs viral post below. With just over 40K followers, Kei‚Äôs educational video to support the Black Lives Matter movement gained over 1.2M views and 360K likes (at the time of publishing this blog post).


So even if you have zero followers, and have never posted to TikTok before, there‚Äôs still an opportunity for your video to appear in the For You page of other users!

Ready to take your TikTok strategy up a notch? Watch our free 30-minute video on how to use TikTok to grow your brand!



How to Personalize Your For You Page: 
Now we know how TikTok decides what appears on your For You page, we can explore how to personalize it!

TikTok is an app for discovery ‚Äî  so even if you only follow 5 accounts, you can still spend hours scrolling through videos (trust us, it can happened!).

So to help you get the most out of your TikTok profile, you can take some action to make sure your For You page is always delivering content that you‚Äôre interested in.

Here‚Äôs some tips from TikTok on how to personalize your For You page: 

#1: Getting Started on TikTok with Category Selection 
When you first set up a TikTok account, you‚Äôll be prompted to select categories that interest you ‚Äî like pets, travel, beauty, sports, etc.

TikTok uses this information to tailor the recommendation in your initial For You page feed ‚Äî as at this stage, you‚Äôve probably not liked, followed, or engaged with any videos yet. TikTok relies on the categories you‚Äôve selected to put the first version of your For You page feed together.

If you don‚Äôt select categories, TikTok will start by offering you a generalized feed of popular videos to get the ball rolling.

From here, TikTok starts to learn more about your interests and preferences based on your likes, comments, and replays.

So if you‚Äôre brand new to TikTok, it‚Äôs worth selecting relevant categories and engaging with the content that you actually enjoy ‚Äî so the algorithm can learn exactly what type of content you want to see.

#2: Find More of What You‚Äôre Interested in
The TikTok algorithm learns from every single action you take on the app.

So the best way to curate your For You page feed is to use and enjoy TikTok. Over time, you‚Äôll see your feed becoming more relevant to your interests.

And according to TikTok, your feed isn‚Äôt only shaped by your engagement on the For You page feed itself.

‚ÄúWhen you decide to follow new accounts, for example, that action will help refine your recommendations too, as will exploring hashtags, sounds, effects, and trending topics on the Discover tab.‚Äù

How to Be Successful on TikTok
Using all of TikTok‚Äôs features will tailor your experience and determine what content makes it into your feed!

#3: Tell TikTok What You‚Äôre Not Interested in 
There‚Äôs a space on TikTok for everyone, but everyone has their own preferences of what they‚Äôd like to see and engage with on the app.

Think of it like your Netflix recommendations, some series might not be for you, but they still deserve their place.

If you come across something that‚Äôs not quite to your liking, you can simply long-press on a video and tap ‚ÄúNot Interested‚Äù to indicate that you don‚Äôt care for a particular video.


You can also choose to hide videos from a given creator or made with a certain sound, or report a video that seems out of line with TikTok‚Äôs guidelines.

All these actions contribute to future recommendations in your For You page feed, helping to create a perfectly personalized feed!

How to Use the TikTok Algorithm to Get Your Content on the For You Page: 
If you‚Äôre a brand, business, or creator on TikTok, the chances are you‚Äôd like to get more views, likes, and comments on your content.

After all, the more eyes on your videos, the more opportunity you have to engage with your TikTok audience and show off your brand.

And the key to getting more engagement on your videos is working with the TikTok algorithm to get your content on as many For You page feeds as possible.


But trust us, getting a coveted spot on a For You page takes a lot more than just adding #fyp to your caption.

To help you create the best content, and get more limelight on the TikTok feed, we‚Äôre going to jump into the top 6 factors that influence the TikTok algorithm!

From nailing your hashtag strategy to choosing trending songs and sounds, we‚Äôre covering everything you need to know to hack the TikTok algorithm:

TikTok Algorithm Factor #1 : Hashtags
As we mentioned above, the For You page is where users aim to land in order to hit the TikTok lottery.

You‚Äôre likely to see the following hashtags on content such as #Foryou, #ForYouPage, and #FYP. But based on TikTok‚Äôs statement on the algorithm, tapping on one of these hashtags doesn‚Äôt guarantee you a spot on the For You page.

@jasonderulo
I can‚Äôt believe @addisonre can moonwalk so good ü§Ø
##fyp
##foryoupage
‚ô¨ #hiteverybeat ‚Äì lulbabyynelii
Knowing exactly what hashtag is best in terms of optimizing your content for the FYP is still relatively mysterious. Vice highlights that if posts include at least one of these #fyp, #foryou, or #foryoupage hashtags in their captions, their posts are more likely to surface on more For You pages.

Along with the #FYP tactic, we‚Äôve seen people utilize the trending hashtag feature to tap into what‚Äôs gaining momentum in real-time.

Everything You Need To Know About TikTok‚Äôs Algorithm 
By tapping the Discover Tab, you can find trending hashtags, as well as typing them out if you want to check a hashtag‚Äôs performance.

Looking for the ones that are getting a lot of traction right now? Just look for the fire icons next to the hashtags and think about incorporating that hashtag into your captain, if the content aligns.


TikTok lets its users know how many views each hashtag gains. And while these numbers can look intimidating ‚Äî especially if they‚Äôre in the millions ‚Äî they‚Äôre also proving this content is favored.

It almost provides a ‚Äúcreative brief‚Äù for users to tap into, such as the latest #albumlookalike challenge, #jamsessions, and #learnfromme hashtags, all prioritized by TikTok.

TIP: Research what hashtags are trending right now and see if your brand can create content to take part!

But be cautious ‚Äî jumping on a hashtag just because it‚Äôs trending may seem like a good idea, but if the hashtag is completely unrelated to the content in your video, it could backfire!

So always find relatable hashtags that will help people discover your content and inform the TikTok algorithm what your video and your profile is all about!

Want to learn more about TikTok hashtags? We jump into the details in this blog post! 

TikTok Algorithm Factor #2: TikTok Captions
Unlike the trend of long captions on Instagram and Facebook, TikTok is not the platform to share an essay.

The ideal caption for TikTok should be short, feature hashtags relating back to the content, and be digestible (and complimentary) to the content you‚Äôre sharing.

TikTok is a mobile-first video platform, so keeping copy short and quippy tends to bring better results.

Everything You Need To Know About TikTok‚Äôs Algorithm 
TIP: Want to make your copy most engaging? Consider asking a question, using a joke, or making the copy a little mysterious or something you need to ‚Äúwait for.‚Äù

 This Is The TikTok Algorithm, Explained
These themes tend to perform well, especially for influencers on the platform.

When it comes to boosting engagement, being able to start and lead a conversation in your comments really pays off. Your video‚Äôs top comments will have a prime spot at the top of your comments list, which means you could spark even more conversation as people will notice the comments on your video as they scroll through TikTok.

 This Is The TikTok Algorithm, Explained
TikTok Algorithm Factor #3: Trending Songs & Sounds
Like hashtags, TikTok‚Äôs music and sounds play a major part in your content‚Äôs discoverability.

The good news is that using a trending song at the right time can mean a quick bump in likes and views.

But unlike TikTok‚Äôs Discover tab, TikTok‚Äôs Sounds are not as easily accessible as a tap of a tab. Unless you‚Äôre actively consuming video or creating one yourself within the app, you need to be a little more stealth in finding what music and sounds are getting the most traction.

Here‚Äôs how you can find trending music (and save music for later):

#1: Sounds in Video Editor
To find new, trending, and popular sounds on TikTok, you‚Äôll need to go into TikTok‚Äôs video editor.

Press the plus icon at the bottom of the screen.

 This Is The TikTok Algorithm, Explained
Don‚Äôt worry, you don‚Äôt have to actually film anything to see what‚Äôs hot! Tap ‚ÄúSounds‚Äù at the top of the screen.

 This Is The TikTok Algorithm, Explained
Now you can have fun and scroll through what‚Äôs trending!


It‚Äôs an awesome hub to find new stuff and make sure you‚Äôre on the pulse of what sounds people are using! This hub is also where your favorites list lives (more on that below!).

#2: Favorites
When you‚Äôre on TikTok, keep an ear out for sounds you like! Similar to ‚ÄúSaves‚Äù on Instagram, favoriting a sound collects it for you in one handy spot.

If you like a sound and want to use it in the future, tap on the sound under the username and tap ‚ÄúAdd to Favorites‚Äù. The Favorites tab is an awesome tool to keep all your favs in one place ‚Äî it‚Äôll come in handy when you need it most!Gaining More Followers on TikTok: The Basics
#3: Sounds Your Followers Listened to
One of the best-kept secrets of the TikTok app is hidden in the Analytics tab of TikTok Pro accounts.

Under the Followers tab, scroll down to find the top sounds your audience has listened to over the last 7 days ‚Äî making it a shortlist of music you could use for your next video!TikTok
TikTok Algorithm Factor #4: When Your Audience is Most Active 
Posting content when your audience is most active is a sure way to get your content seen. And, thanks to TikTok‚Äôs Pro Accounts, you can tap into some juicy audience analytics.


TikTok analytics may not be as in-depth as Instagram analytics, but don‚Äôt be fooled! TikTok gives you a ton of useful information to help you gain a better understanding of your personal best time to post.

TikTok_Audience
Knowing when your audience is live is a great starting point. To help you find your personalized best time to post on TikTok for your brand and business, we‚Äôre covering everything you need to know in this blog post.

Why Some Videos are Instant Hits (and Others are Slow Burners!)
Many people have seen or heard of the ‚Äúslow burn‚Äù phenomenon on TikTok ‚Äî when something is posted, barely gets engagement or reach, and then suddenly pops off on TikTok.

This timing could be 48-hours after posting or up to weeks later, there seems to be no rhyme or reason to it!

For now, we can assume that while videos slowly gain likes, comments, and views, the TikTok algorithm may push your video onto the For You page, even if it‚Äôs not a brand new video.

Or, a sound could suddenly get a lot of exposure, based on someone else‚Äôs video going viral, and your video that features the same sounds could get a little bump!

So it‚Äôs worth keeping in mind that even though you might not get an initial huge reaction, it‚Äôs worth waiting and keeping an eye on your video for weeks, and even months after you‚Äôve posted.

TikTok Algorithm Factor #5: Video Content & Editing 
There‚Äôs no denying that TikTok‚Äôs video style is unique ‚Äî there‚Äôs nothing off-bounds! It‚Äôs a place where creativity flows and you can represent your brand any way you like.

That said, if you‚Äôve covered your bases with the perfect song, the ideal caption, and the timing of your post, but don‚Äôt have a strong video to share it with, does the content still perform? This is perhaps still the biggest unknown of the TikTok algorithm.

One theory is that TikToks with a seamless loop can potentially be a trigger for the algorithm.

@lifewitherick
legends say this video only loads if you have a fast Internet üåö
##perfectloop
##foryoupage
‚ô¨ Perfect Loop ‚Äì lifewitherick
It‚Äôs worth thinking about videos you‚Äôve watched 3 times in a row, or clips you just keep coming back to ‚Äî these are the ones that really grab audience attention and the algorithm could reward you for it!

This is something TikTok is very likely monitoring, serving more of the content all users are gravitating towards. It could be machine learning over personal preference that determines whether a video goes viral or not.

Once you have a good video concept, it‚Äôs worth spending some time editing your TikTok video to make the format even more engaging for viewers.

Feel-good content is filling up For You pages on TikTok and we‚Äôre loving it! But how can brands get involved in creating satisfyingly ‚Äútoo-good-to-watch-once‚Äù videos on the viral app?

We chatted with Kelsey Docherty, TikTok brand consultant, aficionado, and video content pro to share her insights on the latest funny, satisfying, and all-around joyful trends we‚Äôre seeing on the app this week

Stemming from Kelsey‚Äôs trend-watch series, TikTok Thursdays on Instagram, we‚Äôre going to check out what kind of content is making people smile and dive into how easy it is for your brand to try them out.

Why TikTok's Feel-good Content is Trending Right Now
TikTok Trends Overview of the Week
As we learned last week, trending TikTok content is a reflection of current events, social movements, and generally speaking, what is going on in the world.

Thankfully, educational content is still trending, which is what we like to see on TikTok! Make sure to visit the trending hashtag #IndigenousPeoplesDay to learn important information and celebrate the incredible heritage and cultures of First Nations, Inuit, and Metis people.

Check out videos that detail why braids are so significant and suggestions of books to read by Indigenous authors.


But one new trend we‚Äôve spotted in our feeds is the surge of feel-good and joyful content. Rooted in the simple pleasures, we‚Äôve seen trending hashtags like #YogaFlow, #RollerSkating, #PlantLover, and #SelfCareRoutine.


It‚Äôs a great time to showcase a more personal, or behind-the-scenes look at your brand.

Think about a video demonstrating how your employees are practicing self-care during lockdown, or try out a team-building virtual yoga class for some team bonding.

Got an four-legged and fluffy colleague? Now‚Äôs the time to introduce them to your TikTok audience.


The best thing about this trend is that there are no rules. If you feel good about creating it and sharing it with you audience ‚Äî chances are your audience is going to agree!

TikTok Trend of the Week
There is something to be said for ‚Äúsatisfyingly good‚Äù content on TikTok.

Last week, I had a video of a man throwing a giant rock into a pile of mud. It has over a million likes. Was it one of the most perplexing videos that popped up on my For You Page? Yes. Do I know why it garnered so much attention? Also yes.

It‚Äôs because satisfying content on TikTok is fun to watch. It‚Äôs why slime was such a big YouTube and Instagram trend for so long!

Let‚Äôs take a look at @stickyaustralia. They‚Äôre a candy artisan shop based out of Sydney, Australia. Their videos are simply clips of them making hard candy and I can‚Äôt stop watching them!


See what I mean!?

Another brand that does satisfying content so well is LanoLips (coincidentally, also Australian!). They are a beauty brand that specializes in hydrating creams and balms for dry skin.

From a brand standpoint, they‚Äôve got a slight advantage because their product is organically satisfying to watch. Let‚Äôs take a look:


For your next TikTok post, try to see how you could incorporate some type of satisfying content ‚Äî beautiful handwriting, the perfect coffee pour, and even vegetables sliced to perfection are all getting a space on the For You page.

If you‚Äôre stuck on visuals, think about ways to include satisfying audio into the mix (ASMR anyone!?). Take a look at how HypeBeast does it here:


Sign up for Later‚Äôs 10 Day TikTok Challenge and learn how to create perfectly optimized videos on the newest social sharing platform!

Join Our Free TikTok Challenge!
Wondering how to get started with TikTok? Sign up for our free 10-day challenge to learn how to start creating viral videos for your brand!

SIGN UP NOW

By entering your email, you‚Äôre opting-in to receive marketing and product updates from us. You can unsubscribe from these emails any time. Our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy have all the details.

 

Standout TikTok Brands of the Week
@SomeGoodNewsOfficial has been pumping out feel-good content on Instagram since March and they‚Äôve also taken over TikTok. The concept was originally created by John Krasinski as a way to share positive news stories during the challenges of self-isolating and social distancing in COVID-19.

Their social channels are a constant source of inspiration, positivity, and feel-good stories that you‚Äôll want to bring up in your next Zoom call with friends ‚Äî and their TikTok channel is no exception.


TIP: As you can see with some of Some Good News‚Äôs latest posts, animals do really well on TikTok and are a constant source of feel-good content. If there is any way to incorporate animals into your next TikTok video, try it out!


Super simple content goes a long way for your audience on TikTok.

Creators to Watch
#1: @TabithaBrown, CEO of Joyful Content
When I think of joyful content, I immediately think of Tabitha Brown.

She has the most contagiously positive energy that radiates through your phone the minute you hear her voice.


Her content is a mix of educational content, including the most amazing recipes, to just general wisdom and advice, which all of us need a little more of in our lives.

Her most popular video on how to make guacamole, which has 2 million likes and has been shared over 60K times, is the perfect example of why her presence on the app is so magnetic. Let‚Äôs take a look:


Tabitha has so much feel-good content that she was even snapped up by Ellen Digital Network to be part of the ellentube family!


Her TikTok bio says it all: World‚Äôs Favorite Mom.

#2: @DadLifeJason, CEO of Serotonin
@DadLifeJason has almost half a million followers but deserves 10x that! His videos are filled with happiness through music. He‚Äôs often on his talk box, singing and dancing with his family.


It‚Äôs the kind of content that when you see it on your For You Page, you smile and pause for a second. It‚Äôs the type of interruption we all need during our endless bouts of scrolling.

#3: @ThePaperPat, CEO of Teaching Abroad
If you‚Äôre looking for some videos to brighten up your day, I‚Äôd highly recommend checking out @ThePaperPat.

He is currently in Japan teaching English to kids in kindergarten. Cue the ‚Äúawws‚Äù.


He shows us how he interacts with his students, takes us on a tour of his city, and delivers such simple, enjoyable content about his experience as a teacher in Japan that‚Äôll no doubt put a smile on your face.

Now time for your homework. Take a look at your content plan and ideate new ways to connect with your audience on TikTok and weave feel-good content into your next video ‚Äî it‚Äôs easier than you think!

There‚Äôs no denying that social media platforms have changed shape and focus over the last month to rightfully support the Black Lives Matter movement.

But with fast-paced and ever-evolving TikTok, it can be tough to spot the positive changes.

We chatted with Kelsey Docherty, TikTok brand consultant, aficionado, and all-round video content pro to share her insights.

Stemming from Kelsey‚Äôs trend-watch series on her Instagram @kelsey_tries, we‚Äôre chatting educational content, and how brands and creators are using TikTok‚Äôs quick video format to level-up our knowledge!

From important (and essential) awareness videos for #BLM and #Pride, to product styling tips and hoop dance tutorials, TikTok is here to educate, and we‚Äôre here for it.


TikTok Trends Overview of the Week
If you‚Äôve seen a surge of educational content on your #ForYouPage, you‚Äôre not alone.

The usual dance challenges and quirky TikTok trends have taken a backseat to more important issues. It‚Äôs incredible to see brands and creators alike use TikTok as a platform to educate and inform their audience on current events and social issues.

Just look at the shift in content in The Washington Post‚Äôs latest stream of videos. They have always been a reliable source of information and have incorporated TikTok trends into their feed when it makes sense.

Recently they‚Äôve created a number of informational videos that educate their audience on white privilege, systemic racism, and the challenges Black journalists face every single day.


The Daily Show with Trevor Noah is another media outlet that is focusing on educating their audience of 1.2M followers on the Black Lives Matter movement, specifically on police brutality, white allyship, and the meaning behind protesting.


The hashtag #LearnOnTikTok has always been popular and you‚Äôll see it featured on the Discover page on TikTok.

It currently has 7.4B views and thankfully, shows no signs of slowing down as people are craving educational content more than ever.

TikTok often amplifies educational content (like how-to guides, resourceful hacks, and quick tutorials), and recently, we‚Äôve seen the algorithm elevate #BlackLivesMatter content, leveling up educational content and putting it in front of millions of eyes, exactly where it needs to be.

Check out @kei.honey‚Äòs viral post below. With just 30K followers, Kei‚Äôs educational video gained over 750K views and 220K likes!


Another important cultural moment that you can see TikTok amplifying is Pride. The hashtag #MyPride is currently trending on the Discover page and has over 280M views to date.

One of the top videos you‚Äôll see in hashtag is a series called ‚ÄúHistory: But Make It Queer‚Äù, which has 19 episodes to date. Check out episode 1 below, kicked off by @marcsebastianf:

To see how other brands and creators are activating on social media for Pride, check out our blog post on How to Plan a Pride Campaign on Social Media.

With educational content taking prime real estate on TikTok‚Äôs For You and Discover pages, it‚Äôs clear there‚Äôs a cultural shift and demand for content that shares knowledge and personal insight!

Standout TikTok Brand of the Week
Kiitan Akinniranye, @kiitana is a fashion and lifestyle creator and owner of Atarah Avenue, a digital shop for headwraps. She is one of my favorite people to follow on the app and here‚Äôs why.

Her content never fails: she uses popular songs, jumps on trends quickly, posts helpful and educational content, and her seamless transitions are *chef‚Äôs kiss*.

So in short, Kiitan has found the perfect balance to promoting her business and getting involved in the fun side of TikTok!

For example, check out her tutorial on how to style and tie a headwrap:

If you‚Äôre a small brand learning the TikTok ropes, @kiitana is one to watch and learn from! You can also check out our Ultimate Guide to TikTok Marketing to learn more about how to sell your brand on the platform!

TikTok Creators to Watch:
#1: @NotoriousCree, CEO of Traditional Hoop Dance
Of course, dance and choreography didn‚Äôt completely disappear from TikTok this week because I discovered @NotoriousCree!

James Jones is an Indigenous traditional hoop dance artist who has performed globally and is ranked among the top five hoop dancers in the world.

He has just under half a million followers on TikTok and he not only creates beautifully choreographed hoop dance videos and puts his unique twists on popular trends, but also educates his audience on what hoop dancing is, what the hoops represent, and why he dances.

Now that you‚Äôre inspired by these brands and creators who are making digestible, quick-fire educational content for their viewers, it‚Äôs time for you to do the same!

Think about your brand‚Äôs unique point of view and voice and start exploring ways to provide authentic and helpful content to your audience.

We, as people and brands, should always be seeking ways to better ourselves, our audience, and our content, and what better way to do that then through learning! To quote Nelson Mandela: ‚ÄúEducation is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.‚Äù

article.content:
Thinking about using TikTok Ads for your brand or business?

As one of the most downloaded apps of 2020 with over 800 million monthly users ‚Äî now is the time to start.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to make sales, drive traffic to your website, or launch a new product, a creative and well-targeted TikTok campaign can drive great (and huge!) results.

In this guide, discover everything you need to know about the different creative TikTok Ads options.


Table of Contents

Introducing TikTok Ads
TikTok Ads: In-Feed Ads
TikTok Ads: Brand Takeover
TikTok Ads: TopView
TikTok Ads: Branded Hashtag Challenge
TikTok Ads: Branded Effects
How Much do TikTok Ads Cost?
How to Create a TikTok Ad?
Introducing TikTok Ads
From targeting, ad creation, insight reports, and ad management tools, TikTok Ads offer a powerful, yet easy-to-use platform to help businesses and brands advertise to millions of users across the globe.


While TikTok Ads aren‚Äôt as popular as Facebook or Instagram ads (yet!), they‚Äôre an incredible opportunity for brands looking to widen their reach. And now is the perfect time to start using TikTok ads ‚Äî since not many brands and businesses have caught on to their potential.

Whether you‚Äôre a small business with a limited budget or you‚Äôre running a 10-day campaign, TikTok Ads offers a number of unique tools to help brands and businesses excel.

TikTok Ads
Similar to Instagram Ad Manager, TikTok‚Äôs advertising platform-tools automate the process of creating, delivering, and optimizing your ads.

TikTok Ads currently has two budgeting options: daily or lifetime. With both options, your budget isn‚Äôt set in stone ‚Äî you can adjust your budget anytime throughout your campaign.

You can also target your audience by gender, location, age, interests, and other unique variables.

And similar to Facebook and Instagram‚Äôs Ad Manager, you can also create ‚ÄúCustom Audiences‚Äù and ‚ÄúLookalike Audiences‚Äù to reach new audiences that are similar to your existing ones.

Let‚Äôs get into what TikTok Ads actually look like. TikTok offers a variety of different creative ad formats for brands and businesses to explore. You‚Äôve likely seen most of the different types on your daily TikTok scroll.

How to Be Successful on TikTok
Here are the five types of TikTok Ads:

In-Feed Ads
Brand Takeover
TopView
Branded Hashtag Challenge
Branded Effects
With a variety of different options to choose from, it‚Äôs hard to know which ad format is best for your brand ‚Äî which is why we dive into the different types of TikTok ads and how they can work for your business below.

Ready to take your TikTok strategy up a notch? Watch our free 30-minute video on how to use TikTok to grow your brand! 



TikTok Ads: In-Feed Ads 
In-Feed Ads are the video ads that appear in between user videos as you scroll through your For You page. If you‚Äôre unfamiliar with TikTok and the For You page, In-Feed Ads are very similar to the ads you‚Äôd see while tapping through Instagram Stories.


You can get super creative with In-Feed Ads. You can include multiple call-to-actions and make your video anywhere between 9 to 15 seconds.

Having the opportunity to include a call-to-action is a huge advantage. For example, you can encourage users to shop now, download your app, or visit your website right from TikTok.

See how Adobe uses a clear CTA in their In-Feed Ad below.

How to Be Successful on TikTok
One thing to keep in mind is that like any other video on your For You Page, In-Feed Ads can be scrolled past or skipped pretty quickly. You only have about 2-3 seconds to catch your audience‚Äôs eye before they keep scrolling.

In-Feed Ads should be full screen and should be enticing enough to stop users from scrolling past your content.

When it comes to stopping the scroll, Sawyer Hartman, the CEO of Cameras on TikTok, gave some sound advice on our ‚ÄúTalk the Tok‚Äù Workshop:

‚ÄúThe text on TikTok videos should establish a problem or grab attention right away. Imagine your perfect viewer is sitting and watching your video with the sound off, what text can you put and what story can you tell that will convince them to turn their sound on?‚Äù

SAWYER HARTMAN

Hear more tips and tricks from Sawyer and our other TikTok experts in the full TikTok Workshop here:



Another positive to In-Feed Ads? TikTok users can like, comment, share, and interact with your video just like any other video on the For You page.

TIP: Work with influencers for your In-Feed ads! Take Levi‚Äôs for example.

Levi‚Äôs worked with several TikTok creators ‚Äî sending each of them their Future Finish 3D denim customization technology, giving them full creative control over their jeans.

TikTok Ads
The creators‚Äô videos appeared on TikTok as In-Feed Ads where users could click on the ‚ÄúShop Now‚Äù button to buy the same design on Levi‚Äôs website.

TikTok Ads: Brand Takeover 
Have you ever opened up TikTok and received an ad right away? If so, those are Brand Takeover Ads.

Brand Takeover Ads appear upon opening the app ‚Äî presenting a full-screen video to your targeted audience.


 

They‚Äôre one of TikTok Ad‚Äôs best options for delivering mass awareness and driving direct sales since you can place your messaging right in front of your target audience.

Not only do these ads show up as soon as users open TikTok, but they can also appear on the For You page as still images, GIFs or videos ‚Äî including a clickable link driving users to a landing page or a Hashtag Challenge within TikTok.

See how Guess Jeans had their #InMyDenim Challenge advertised all across TikTok. The photo below on the far left is an example of a Brand Takeover.

How to Go Viral on TikTok
Source: TikTok Ads

Brand Takeover Ads are exclusive to their category, which means that TikTok makes sure users don‚Äôt see more than one Brand Takeover per day. With Brand Takeover Ads you can expect a lot of eyes on your content with little competition.

If you‚Äôre just starting out with TikTok Ads, Brand Takeovers may not be your first choice. Because, while super effective, Brand Takeovers do come at a high cost.

If you‚Äôre a bigger brand with a large marketing budget, they are a great option for fast growth and reaching a large group of TikTok users.

Join Our Free TikTok Challenge!
Wondering how to get started with TikTok? Sign up for our free 10-day challenge to learn how to start creating viral videos for your brand!

email@website.com

Industry

Number of Instagram Followers

SIGN UP NOW

By entering your email, you‚Äôre opting-in to receive marketing and product updates from us. You can unsubscribe from these emails any time. Our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy have all the details.

 

TikTok Ads: TopView 
TopView Ads are a new advertising option that builds on Brand Takeovers.

What makes TopView Ads different is that unlike Branded Takeover Ads, TikTok users aren‚Äôt bombarded with an ad as soon as they open the app ‚Äî TopView Ads are the first in-feed post after 3 seconds.


TikTok Ads

It shows up at the top of the For You page, TikTok‚Äôs most premium real estate, with up to 60-seconds of full-screen video with auto-play and sound.

TikTok Ads: Branded Hashtag Challenge 
Branded Hashtag Challenges are a one-of-a-kind advertising opportunity exclusively to TikTok. You‚Äôve probably seen branded hashtag challenges displayed on TikTok‚Äôs Discovery page.

Similar to regular hashtag trends and challenges on TikTok, Branded Hashtags Challenges offer both organic and sponsored opportunities for brands.


 

They‚Äôre a great way to encourage user-generated content and build brand awareness.

The best part about Branded Hashtag Challenges? You can have a ton of fun with them! They are an awesome way for brands to collaborate and seamlessly integrate themselves into the TikTok culture and community.

It‚Äôs important to have concrete objectives when you‚Äôre creating a Branded Hashtag Challenge. Are you looking to create awareness for a new product? Generate new leads? Or increase general brand awareness?

When a user clicks on a sponsored hashtag, they‚Äôre taken to a landing page on TikTok with the brand logo, link to their website, brief description of the challenge, and popular videos using the hashtag.

TikTok Ads
If you‚Äôre looking for maximum exposure, you can pay up to a hefty $150,000 per day to show up on TikTok‚Äôs Discover banner. That‚Äôs huge real estate but it‚Äôs not the only way to get users engaged with your branded hashtag.

TIP: If you‚Äôre looking for a less costly alternative, partner with popular creators on TikTok, like Houseparty and Freal Milkshakes below, to help your challenge take off!

Check out how the popular video messaging app, Houseparty, uses branded hashtags in a recent campaign on TikTok.

See how Houseparty partnered with Gen-Z heartthrob Chase Stokes (or better known as ‚ÄúJohn B‚Äù from Outer Banks) to help push their hashtag even further.


Another example is Freal Milkshakes. The popular milkshake machine also partnered with popular TikTok creators to show off their creations.


 

Since the campaign, @therealfreal has over 500 thousand followers with over 200 million hashtag video views with users showing off their milkshakes.

ICYMI: TikTok now offers an e-commerce feature called the Hashtag Challenge Plus ‚Äî a feature that lets users shop for products right in the app.

The Hashtag Challenge Plus feature ‚Äî which has only started rolling out on select accounts ‚Äî offers a separate ‚ÄúDiscover‚Äù tab on the hashtag‚Äôs landing page where TikTok users can browse products from the campaign and purchase them right within TikTok.


TikTok Ads: Branded Effects
TikTok now offers branded shareable stickers, AR filters, and lenses in their advertising mix.

Similar to Snapchat‚Äôs branded lenses, TikTok‚Äôs branded effects allow brands to design their own custom filter on the app.


TikTok Ads

Branded Effects can be live for up to 10 days at a time and are an awesome way to encourage users to directly interact with your brand (in a fun way!).

How Much do TikTok Ads Cost?
TikTok Ads are new to the scene ‚Äî brands and businesses are still experimenting with the platform ‚Äî so understanding the average spend or return on investment (ROI) is difficult.

So, if you‚Äôre a small business and want to give TikTok ads a try, don‚Äôt let the unknown scare you off right away ‚Äî spending big bucks on TikTok isn‚Äôt the only way to advertise on the popular app.

You can set up a free TikTok Ads account and create In-Feed ads with your own set budget and schedule. Currently, TikTok‚Äôs minimum campaign budget is $500 and the minimum ad group budget is $50.

However, it has also been reported that the cost of advertising on TikTok can be anywhere from $50,000 to $120,000, depending on the type and duration.

If these reported numbers are true, it would make sense as to why we haven‚Äôt really seen smaller businesses advertising on TikTok just yet.

As more brands begin to engage and use TikTok Ads, it will become more clear whether TikTok will follow a similar model to Instagram and Facebook ads where (no budget is too small), or if they will continue to keep certain ad types, like branded hashtag challenges, as elite spends.

Watch this space!

How to Create a TikTok Ad
Now that you‚Äôre familiar with TikTok‚Äôs creative advertising options, it‚Äôs time to talk about the tools that help get your ads into action.

Before you can go ahead and create ads on TikTok, even In-Feed ads, you have to be approved by TikTok. It‚Äôs not a difficult process, just an extra step to keep in mind.

Here is how to request a TikTok Ads account:

#1: Head to the TikTok Ads homepage.


#2: Enter your country and account type and press ‚ÄúNext‚Äù.


#3: TikTok Ads is currently only available in certain regions. Fill out all of your contact information and depending on if TikTok Ads self-serve is available in your region, either press ‚ÄúMake a Reservation‚Äù or ‚ÄúInform me of Future Updates‚Äù.

Note: TikTok Ads Manager self-serve platform is now available in the United States for businesses of all sizes.


#4: Now it‚Äôs time to wait for TikTok to send more information.  Make sure to double-check all your email folders (promotions, social, junk, etc).

Follow these steps if you don‚Äôt receive verification.

TIP: If you know you want to start advertising on TikTok in the future (even if it‚Äôs not for a while!) create an account sooner than later to be sure you have it there when you‚Äôre ready.

Once you get the verification email, TikTok asks a number of questions about your business and advertising goals. After you submit the questionnaire, a TikTok representative will be in touch with you over email to help you complete the process.

Following that, you‚Äôll be able to enter and officially set up your account.

On TikTok‚Äôs self-serve platform, you can create and run campaigns, easily define your target audience, select bidding methods, and design your ad creative.

Note: As of right now, it‚Äôs unclear whether you can login to the platform and create a Branded Hashtag Challenge campaign or if you need to work directly with a TikTok sales rep to do so. According to Digiday, some advertising campaigns are managed and monitored by TikTok‚Äôs own team.

And there you have it, our quick guide to TikTok Ads.

By now, you should have a clear understanding of TikTok‚Äôs creative advertising options and the early steps on how you can put them into practice for your business.

Your best time to post on TikTok can seem mysterious, but once you have it figured out, you‚Äôll soon start to reap the benefits.

From reaching new engaged audiences to seeing a boost in likes, comments, and followers, your best time to post is the key to unlocking your best TikTok engagement.

To help you find your best time to post and build a killer TikTok strategy in 2021, we‚Äôre covering everything you need to know in this blog post.


What is the Best Time to Post on TikTok?  
The first thing to know is that there‚Äôs no one-size-fits-all approach to finding your best time to post ‚Äî every brand, business, or influencer on TikTok will have a slightly different best time to post.

How To Figure Out The Best Time To Post On TikTok
As just by knowing your best time to post, you‚Äôre giving yourself a unique advantage.

Plus, once you‚Äôve discovered your best time to post, you can get early access to Later‚Äôs TikTok scheduling tools.

With TikTok Planning and Scheduling, you‚Äôll always be able to share your videos at the perfect time for your audience ‚Äî so you‚Äôll never miss an engagement opportunity again.

Get exclusive early access to visual planning and scheduling for TikTok on web and mobile.

  EARLY ACCESS 

Schedule TikTok videos from your laptop or phone
Visually plan and schedule your TikTok videos right inside Later. Available on paid plans.

Sign Me Up

 

Ready to discover your best time to post on TikTok? Here are 4 steps to help you get started:

Step #1: Create A Pro Account
TikTok‚Äôs analytics are only available on Pro Accounts, which means that if you‚Äôre serious about growing on TikTok, now‚Äôs the time to make the upgrade.

Switching to a Pro TikTok account will unlock your profile‚Äôs metrics and data insights, and these analytics are key to figuring out your best time to post.

TikTok Pro
Here‚Äôs how to switch to a Pro TikTok Account:

Go to the ‚ÄúManage my account‚Äù section by tapping the three dots in the top right corner of your profile page
Select ‚ÄúSwitch to Pro account‚Äù
Choose your business industry
Your TikTok account will reload a Pro Account with a new analytics section
How To Figure Out The Best Time To Post On TikTok
Within the analytics section of a Pro account, you‚Äôll find 3 tabs: Overview, Content, and Followers.

Tap the Followers tab to track your follower growth, top territories, and followers‚Äô activities:

How To Figure Out The Best Time To Post On TikTok
TIP: Keep track of your follower growth on a separate reporting template and log it daily, as the app only stores the last 28 days of data.

Not only will sparks in your follower growth be indicators of your best time to post each week, but it will also indicate that you‚Äôve shared content your audience loves! Use that to inform your content and posting strategy for the future.

Step #2: Identify Your Top Territories 
Thanks to TikTok‚Äôs Top Territories analytics, it‚Äôs easy to find out where your audience is based, which will help you figure out your best time to post.

How To Figure Out The Best Time To Post On TikTok
In this example, a good portion of our audience is based in the US, with smaller percentages scattered across Europe, Canada, and Mexico.

However, unlike Instagram, TikTok doesn‚Äôt break this info down into cities, so while we know the US is the main audience, there‚Äôs a lot of different time zones to take into account.

For example, if you‚Äôre a brand based in NYC and assume the majority of your audience is living on Eastern Standard Time, you‚Äôll definitely want to capture audiences within that time zone when you post.

But you have to take into account that most people on the West Coast are asleep at 8 am EST, so you could be missing out on engagement if you don‚Äôt take this into account.

So your business‚Äô best times to post on TikTok could go beyond a schedule you‚Äôre used to.

‚ÄúAt Later, a majority of our audience on TikTok is US-based so we try not to post too early or too late to exclude any of our audience. Our sweet spot tends to be midday PST to catch most people and timezones.‚Äù

‚Äì LINDSAY ASHCRAFT, SOCIAL MEDIA COORDINATOR AT LATER

Plus, the TikTok algorithm factors in where you post content from.

The Later team is based all over the world, across multiple time zones and we all take part in creating content for our TikTok profile ‚Äî that‚Äôs why you‚Äôll see so many different faces there!

That also means we post from all over the world, from Northern California to London.

When Is The Best Time To Post On TikTok? 
So if you‚Äôre consistently posting from the same location, the chances are you‚Äôll build a stronger audience there.

It‚Äôs important to identify where the majority of your audience is based, and then try to predict when they‚Äôll most be active online.

Looking to level-up your TikTok skills? Join Later‚Äôs 10-day Challenge! Each day we‚Äôll show you a new TikTok skill or hack that you can use on your own TikTok feed.

Join Our Free TikTok Challenge!
Wondering how to get started with TikTok? Sign up for our free 10-day challenge to learn how to start creating viral videos for your brand!

email@website.com

Industry

Number of Instagram Followers

SIGN UP NOW

By entering your email, you‚Äôre opting-in to receive marketing and product updates from us. You can unsubscribe from these emails any time. Our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy have all the details.

 

Step #3: Know When Your Audience is Most Active 
TikTok‚Äôs built-in analytics may seem a little basic, but don‚Äôt be fooled.

Everything you need to figure out the best time to post is in the Analytics tab, especially when it comes to knowing when your audience is most active.

Under the Follower tab of your TikTok Analytics, scroll down to find the ‚ÄúFollower Activity‚Äù section.

When Is The Best Time To Post On TikTok? 
Here you‚Äôll find detailed information on your audience‚Äôs most active hours and days.

NOTE: All information in TikTok analytics is recorded in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). As a result, you‚Äôll need to convert the hours that your followers are most active into the timezones of your audience‚Äôs location.

When Is The Best Time To Post On TikTok? 
From this example, you can see that our followers are most active at 7pm UTC, which is 12pm PST and 3pm EST.

TIP: Use a timezone conversion tool to easily switch between time zones.

Step #4: Track and Measure Your Content Performance 
The final step to understanding your best time to post is to monitor your content performance.

Delving into the analytics for top posts is a great way to learn how your posting times correlate to performance.

Under the Content tab in TikTok Analytics, you‚Äôll be able to see all your posts‚Äô performance over the last 7 days.

When Is The Best Time To Post On TikTok? 
Once you click on a video, you‚Äôll be able to see tons of performance data on your content ‚Äî like total views, average watch time, traffic source time, as well as where in the world your views came from.

To help you figure out your best time to post, first take a look at the overall performance ‚Äî how many likes, comments, and shares the video received.

When Is The Best Time To Post On TikTok? 
Take a look and see, is there a connection between when the TikTok video was posted and how well it performed?

When Is The Best Time To Post On TikTok? 
It‚Äôs really useful to keep a spreadsheet or reporting document to track all your TikTok content performance, especially as TikTok only captures data for the last 7 days.

Here‚Äôs a couple of metrics you‚Äôll want to keep track of per video:

Posting Date and Time
Video Likes
Video Comments
Video Shares
Total Play Time
Total Video Views
Traffic Source Types
Total Reached Audience
Top Audience Territories
We‚Äôve created our own reporting template to make it easier for you to get started: Later Social Media Reporting Template: 

Free Social Media Reporting Templates
email@website.com

Industry

Number of Instagram Followers
 Yes, I would like to receive email marketing communication from Later. I understand that I can unsubscribe at any time.

DOWNLOAD NOW

By entering your email, you‚Äôre accepting Later's Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.

 

When it comes to honing in on your best time to post, take note of the content that performed the best each week and identify when it was posted.

Video Performance + Time Posted + Audience Timezone = Best Time to Post 

Of course, there is still a bit of guesswork left in the mix ‚Äî as we already mention, there is no definitive answer of when every brand should post to TikTok!

But this should give you a strong indication of what time will work for you and your audience.

From here, you can fine-tune as you start to manage and measure your content performance.

You may notice that as your profile grows, your audience location and online behaviors change too, so keep checking in on your reporting and altering your strategy.

While getting to grips with TikTok analytics and the best time to post can feel daunting, there‚Äôs a huge payoff for your brand.

Are you ready to get started on TikTok?  You‚Äôve come to the right place.

In this step-by-step guide, we break down everything you need to know to get started on TikTok and create your very first video ‚Äî everything from how to set up your account to how to use all of TikTok‚Äôs editing tools.

Let‚Äôs get started!


Table of Contents:

Set Up Your TikTok Account
Film and Upload Your Content
Edit Your Video (In the App!)
Publish Your TikTok
Get Started on TikTok Step #1: Set Up Your TikTok Account
Before you can browse the famous For You page or post, you‚Äôll have to create a TikTok account.

First, go to the App Store or Google Play and download the TikTok app. Once downloaded, sign up with Facebook, Gmail, or Twitter, or create a new username and password using your email.

Create your first tiktok
By default, TikTok assigns all users a unique username made up of a random collection of letters and numbers. It‚Äôs not super cute, so let‚Äôs change that!

For best practice ‚Äî and maximum cross-platform discoverability ‚Äî set your username to your name or your business name, or whatever username you use for your other channels! This helps create a seamless extension of your already established brand.

TikTok username
TIP: Looking to do something different? Be creative by working with puns, punctuation, and more!

Once logged in, you‚Äôll be brought to the homepage.

It‚Äôs time to edit your profile! To edit, tap ‚ÄúMe‚Äù in the bottom right corner.


 Tap ‚ÄúEdit Profile‚Äù.

tiktok edit profile
First, let‚Äôs change our TikTok profile picture. TikTok allows you to choose between a static image or a video.

tiktok profile picture
It‚Äôs a good idea to align your profile picture, just like your username, with the picture you use across other social channels.

Your profile picture isn‚Äôt the only important piece of the TikTok profile puzzle.

Next, it‚Äôs time to write your TikTok bio.

tiktok bio
Your TikTok bio is important ‚Äî  it‚Äôs one of the first places your audience will look. TikTok allows up to 80 characters, allowing you to share a short and sweet bio at the forefront of your profile.

Add a tiktok bio
Not sure what to write for your bio? Here are 25 creative Instagram bio examples you‚Äôll definitely want to copy!

If you‚Äôre one of the lucky ones, you‚Äôll notice a ‚Äúwebsite‚Äù field in your edit settings.


However, only certain TikTok accounts can capitalize on the TikTok link in bio by default right now.
The TikTok link in bio (website field), is one of the few places where you can add a clickable link on the app, making it a valuable resource for brands looking to drive traffic and sales.

Check out this blog post for a step-by-step on how to add a link to your TikTok bio.

TikTok also allows for seamless YouTube and Instagram integration. It‚Äôs a good idea to input your Instagram and YouTube accounts so that your audience can follow you outside of TikTok.


They‚Äôll be showcased on your profile next to the follow button.


Now that your profile is all set up, it‚Äôs time to follow users and engage in content!

On TikTok, you don‚Äôt necessarily have to follow accounts to see their content. Most content appears on your personalized For You page.

Following accounts and engaging with content lets TikTok know what you‚Äôre interested in and helps TikTok‚Äôs algorithm create a personalized For You page.
